Section.Catchline: Effect of partnership agreement; nonwaivable provisions.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise provided in subsection (2), relations among partners and between partners and a partnership are governed by the partnership agreement. To the extent the partnership agreement does not otherwise provide, this act governs relations among partners and between partners and a partnership.

Paragraph.Text: Vary the rights and duties under s. 620.8105 except to eliminate the duty to provide copies of statements to all of the partners;
Vary the law applicable to a limited liability partnership under s. 620.8106(2);
Unreasonably restrict the right of access to books and records under s. 620.8403(2) or to information under s. 620.8403(3);
Eliminate the duty of loyalty under s. 620.8404(2) or s. 620.8603(2)(c), but:

SubParagraph.Text: The partnership agreement may identify specific types or categories of activities that do not violate the duty of loyalty, if not manifestly unreasonable; or

All of the partners or a number or percentage specified in the partnership agreement may authorize or ratify, after full disclosure of all material facts, a specific act or transaction that otherwise would violate the duty of loyalty;

Paragraph.Text: Unreasonably reduce the duty of care under s. 620.8404(3) or s. 620.8603(2)(c);

Eliminate the obligation of good faith and fair dealing under s. 620.8404(4), but the partnership agreement may prescribe the standards by which the performance of the obligation is to be measured if the standards are not manifestly unreasonable;
Vary the power to dissociate as a partner under s. 620.8602(1), except to require the notice under s. 620.8601(1) to be in writing;
Vary the right of a court to expel a partner under the events specified in s. 620.8601(5);
Vary the requirement to wind up the partnership business in cases specified in s. 620.8801(4), (5), or (6); or
Restrict rights of third parties under this act.
